summary.para: Creates an instance of the CXAPOBase class.

param.name: pRegistrationProperties
param.para: Pointer to an structure containing the registration properties for the XAPO.

remarks.para: The object created by this CXAPOBase will have a reference count of 1.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Returns a pointer to the structure containing the registration properties the XAPO was created with.

returns.para: Pointer to the structure containing the registration properties the XAPO was created with.

remarks.para: Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Queries whether the XAPO is locked.

returns.para: Returns TRUE if the XAPO is locked for processing; otherwise returns FALSE.

remarks.para: Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

member.name: CXAPOBase.ProcessThru

summary.para: Called by an implementation when an XAPO is disabled for thru processing.

param.name: pInputBuffer
param.para: Pointer to a buffer containing the input audio data.

param.name: pOutputBuffer
param.para: Pointer to a buffer that will contain the processed audio data.

param.name: FrameCount
param.para: Number of frames of audio data to process, where a frame is a block of samples, one per channel of audio data.

param.name: InputChannelCount
param.para: Number of channels in the input data buffer.

param.name: OutputChannelCount
param.para: Number of channels in the output data buffer.

param.name: MixWithOutput
param.para: TRUE to mix with the destination buffer, FALSE to overwrite the destination buffer.

member.remarks:
ProcessThru copies/mixes data from source to destination, making as few changes as possible to the audio data. However, ProcessThru is capable of channel upmix/downmix and uses the same matrix coefficient table used by windows Vista to do so.
This function may be called if:
The XAPO is locked and disabled.
The number of source frames equals the number of destination frames.
The output format is FLOAT32.
input format is INT8, INT16, INT20 (contained in 24 or 32 bits), INT24 (contained in 24 or 32 bits), INT32, or FLOAT32.
For in-place processing (where the input buffer equals the output buffer) this function does nothing.
When writing a ProcessThru method it is important to note XAudio2 audio data is interleaved, data from each channel is adjacent for a particular sample number. For example if there was a 4 channel wave playing into an XAudio2 source voice, the audio data would be a sample of channel 0, a sample of channel 1, a sample of channel 2, a sample of channel 3, and then the next sample of channels 0, 1, 2, 3, etc.
Platform Requirements
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Verifies that an audio format falls within the default ranges supported.

param.name: fOverwrite
param.para: If TRUE indicates that pFormat should be overwritten with the nearest audio format supported if the format it specified is not supported. The nearest audio format is determined by bit depth, framerate and channel count in that order of importance.

returns.para: Return S_OK if the audio format is supported. Returns XAPO_E_FORMAT_UNSUPPORTED if the audio format is unsupported, pFormat will be overwritten with the nearest audio format if fOverwrite is TRUE. Returns E_INVALIDARG if the audio format is invalid, in which case pFormat will be left untouched.

remarks.para: Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Verifies that an input and output format pair configuration is supported by the XAPO.

param.name: pSupportedFormat
param.para: An audio format known to be supported by the XAPO.

param.name: pRequestedFormat
param.para: An audio format to examine, must be a pointer to a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure if fOverWrite is TRUE.

param.name: fOverwrite
param.para: If TRUE indicates that pRequestedFormat should be overwritten with the nearest audio format supported if the requested format is not supported. The nearest audio format is determined by bit depth, framerate and channel count in that order of importance.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the format pair is supported. Returns XAPO_E_FORMAT_UNSUPPORTED if the format pair is unsupported; pRequestedFormat will be overwritten if fOverWrite is TRUE. Returns E_INVALIDARG if either audio format was invalid; pRequestedFormat will be left untouched.

remarks.para: Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)
